meanings.definition: Soft and yielding to the touch.
meanings.sent1: The squushy pillow was perfect for napping.
meanings.sent2: The marshmallow was so squushy, it melted in my mouth.
meanings.sent3: The squushy teddy bear seemed to give the best hugs.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt squushy with love for her family.
meanings.sent5: The squushy clouds floated lazily in the sky.

meanings.definition: Making a soft, wet sound when pressed.
meanings.sent1: The squushy mud made a funny noise under my boots.
meanings.sent2: The squushy tomato burst with a squishy sound.
meanings.sent3: The squushy sponge soaked up all the water in the sink.
meanings.sent4: The squushy grapes popped in my mouth with juice.
meanings.sent5: The squushy snow made a satisfying crunch underfoot.

meanings.definition: To crush or flatten something with a soft, wet sound.
meanings.sent1: I squushy the playdough between my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The chef squushied the garlic cloves with the back of a knife.
meanings.sent3: She squushied the grapes to make fresh juice.
meanings.sent4: The toddler squushied the clay into a misshapen blob.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain squushied the flowers in the garden bed.
